Description: India's eight classical dance forms - Bharatanatyam, Kathakali, Mohiniyattam, Kuchipudi, Odissi, Sattriya, Manipuri, and Kathak - are recognized by the Sangeet Natak Akademi and have ancient origins codified in the Natya Shastra.
Associated States: Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Assam, Manipur, North India

Description: The two major classical music traditions - Hindustani (North) and Carnatic (South) - feature distinct ragas, talas, and performance styles with centuries of continuous evolution.
Associated States: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Bengal

Description: India's diverse folk art traditions include Madhubani, Warli, Kalamkari, Phad, Pattachitra, and many others, each with unique regional styles and cultural significance.

Description: India's UNESCO World Heritage Sites include architectural marvels, natural wonders, and cultural landmarks spanning thousands of years of history.
Associated States: Multiple states across India

Description: Living traditions include yoga, Ayurveda, traditional agricultural practices, water harvesting techniques, and indigenous knowledge systems.

Description: India's festival traditions encompass religious celebrations, harvest festivals, and cultural events with regional variations.

Description: Protected monuments under Archaeological Survey of India represent diverse architectural styles and historical periods.

Description: Traditional knowledge systems include agricultural practices, water management, medicine, astronomy, and mathematics.
